flash.--target: The firmware version to compile against. Defaults to latest version, or version on device for cellular.  [string]
flash.--product: Target a device within the given Product ID or Slug  [string]

compile.--target: The firmware version to compile against. Defaults to latest version, or version on device for cellular.  [string]

nyan.--product: Target a device within the given Product ID or Slug  [string]

login.-t: --token     an existing Particle access token to use  [string]
login.--otp: the login code if two-step authentication is enabled  [string]

call.--product: Target a device within the given Product ID or Slug  [string]

new.--protocol: Communication protocol for the device using the key. tcp or udp  [string]

save.--force: Force overwriting of <filename> if it exists  [boolean] [default: false]

send.--product_id: The product ID to use when provisioning a new device  [number]

doctor.--protocol: Communication protocol for the device using the key. tcp or udp  [string]

server.--protocol: Communication protocol for the device using the key. tcp or udp  [string]
server.--host: Hostname or IP address of the server to add to the key  [string]
server.--port: Port number of the server to add to the key  [number]
server.--deviceType: Generate key file for the provided device type  [string]

address.--protocol: Communication protocol for the device using the key. tcp or udp  [string]

protocol.--protocol: Communication protocol for the device using the key. tcp or udp  [string]

create.--name: The name of the library to create.  [string]
create.--version: The initial version of the library to create.  [string]

list.--filter: filters libraries not matching the text  [string]
list.--non-interactive: Prints a single page of libraries without prompting  [boolean]
list.--page: Start the listing at the given page number  [number]
list.--limit: The number of items to show per page  [number]

migrate.--test: --dryrun  test if the library can be migrated  [boolean]
migrate.--adapter: add include file adapters to support v1-style includes "library/library.h"  [boolean] [default: true]

upload.--dryRun: perform validation steps but don't actually upload the library.  [boolean]

view.--readme: display the readme for the library  [boolean]
view.--source: display the main source file for the library  [boolean]
view.--header: display the main header file for the library  [boolean]

create.--password: Network password. The minimum password length is 6 characters  [string]
create.--channel: Network channel. By default, the device will try to pick the least congested channel in your environment  [number]

create.--name: provide a name for the project  [string]

monitor.--follow: Reopen the port after it closes, for example when the device resets  [boolean]
monitor.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

identify.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

wifi.--file: Take the credentials from a JSON file instead of prompting for them  [string]
wifi.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

mac.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

inspect.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

flash.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

claim.--port: Use this serial port instead of auto-detecting. Useful if there are more than 1 connected device  [string]

revoke.--force: Force deleting access token used by this CLI  [boolean]

create.--expires-in: Create a token valid for this many seconds. When omitted, the Particle API assigns a default expiration.  [number]
create.--never-expires: Create a token that doesn't expire. Useful for a token that will be used by a cloud application for making Particle API requests.  [boolean]

list.--exclude-dfu: Do not list devices which are in DFU mode  [boolean]

start-listening.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

listen.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

stop-listening.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

safe-mode.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

dfu.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

reset.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

setup-done.--all: Send the command to all devices connected to the host computer  [boolean]

cloud-status.--until: Poll your device for a specific connection state and then exit  [string] [choices: "unknown", "disconnected", "connecting", "connected", "disconnecting"]
cloud-status.--timeout: How long should polling wait (in ms) for the requested status?  [number] [default: 60000]

get.--time: Show the time when the variable was received  [boolean]
get.--product: Target a device within the given Product ID or Slug  [string]

monitor.--time: Show the time when the variable was received  [boolean]
monitor.--delay: Interval in milliseconds between variable fetches  [number]
